Expansion for Krosmaster Blast and Krosmaster Arena

Contains the 4 figures:
-Master Bolete
-Black Widow
-Anne Snare
-The Spinner

Name: Krosmaster: Arena – Gloomy Grove Classic Pack 1
Description:
Expansion for Krosmaster Blast and Krosmaster Arena

Contains the 4 figures:
-Whisterly
-Grace Ovspades
-Derrig Loo
-Lydia Vokin

Name: Krosmaster: Arena – Gloomy Grove Classic Pack 2
Description:
Expansion for Krosmaster Blast and Krosmaster Arena

Contains the 4 figures:
-Alban Dage
-Albinarachnee
-Melissa Kura
-Earl Lee Araknee

Name: ¡Caninos!
Description:
¡Caninos! es un juego de cartas de pizza en el que competirás para robar más pizza que cualquier otra persona. Sé el primero en alcanzar 50 puntos en porciones de pizza y ganarás el juego. Pero, ¿cómo? te preguntarás. ¡No te preocupes, estamos aquí para ayudarte! Contarás con las habilidades asombrosas de perros súper poderosos que están más que ansiosos por robar pizza para ti, ¡y son los mejores en ello! No solo pueden conseguirte pizza, sino que también pueden hacer trucos sorprendentes que dificultarán las cosas para tus oponentes y te pondrán por delante en el juego.

Pero, ten cuidado: otros jugadores intentarán detenerte con trucos y cartas de reacción destinadas a asustar a tus perros. Juega con cuidado y usa los ingredientes a tu favor: podrás añadir ingredientes que  aumentarán el valor de tus porciones de pizza, pero otros ingredientes lo reducirán... y si la situación se pone difícil y necesitas ayuda adicional, siempre puedes contar con los trucos especiales de los Sabuesos del Caos y las misteriosas artimañas de los (casi) todopoderosos Mapaches Místicos.

¡Caninos! es un juego familiar moderadamente estratégico en el que deberás evaluar tus posibilidades, tomar decisiones y gestionar tus cartas con sabiduría para convertirte en el mejor ladrón de pizza de todos los tiempos.

—description from the publisher

¡Caninos! is a pizza card game where you will compete to steal more pizza than anybody else. Be the first to score 50 points worth of pizza slices and you'll win the game. But how?  You may ask. Don't worry, we got you covered; you'll count on the amazing skills of super powerful dogs that are more than eager to steal pizza for you, and they're the best at it too! Not only can they get you pizza, but they can also do amazing tricks that will make things harder for your opponents and put you ahead of the game.

Be mindful though, other players will try to stop you with tricks and reaction cards meant to scare your dogs away. Tread lightly and use toppings to your advantage: upgrade toppings will increase the value of pizza slices while downgrade toppings will lower it... and if push comes to shove and you need some extra help you can always count on the special tricks of the Hounds of Chaos, and the mysterious ways of the (almost) almighty Mystic Raccoons.

¡Caninos! is a mildly strategic family game where you'll need to evaluate your possibilities, make some decisions, and manage your cards wisely to become the greatest pizza thief ever.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dope or Nope: Family Card Game
Description:
Combine product cards together to create dope new inventions and pitch those inventions to buyers (a.k.a the judge). The dopest invention wins!

With over 265 products product cards, The opportunities to create hilarious products are limitless. This party game is a blast to play with family and friends. Unleash the hilarity and creativity of your mind!

—description from the designer

Name: DC Deck-Building Game: Rebirth – Learning The Ropes
Description:
Training Scenario Card originally part of the DC Deck-Building Game: Rebirth Launch Kit.

This scenario is perfect for running demos with or teaching people how to play the game.

Name: Stars & Lasers!!: The Pride & The Passion
Description:
The Pride & The Passion is a mini campaign for Stars & Lasers, where seven scenario's are linked, starting with a meeting engagement with a twist, in “Diplomatic Incident” and then you get to fight through six more scenarios following the exploits of a proud warrior and his crew.

The scenarios allow you to play the battles of a lone Battlecruiser and its crew as they attempt to bring honour to their people, or you could play from the other side as the people trying to stop them entering your territory.

The scenarios could also be played as single one off games.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sagrada: The Great Facades – Life
Description:
From Publisher:

Return to the famous Sagrada Familia cathedral in Sagrada: Life, the second of the three Great Facades expansions. This modular expansion explores the journey of life—through hardships and helpers—add everything inside or handpick modules to enhance your crafting experience.

Sagrada: Life introduces new challenges to test your artisanal skills. Gain helpful abilities through apprentice cards, draft masterwork dice to gain prestige for tackling tricky new restrictions, and reap the rewards of rising to the challenge of toil public objectives. Will your stained glass window be a true masterpiece?

This expansion adds 3 new modules, each interchangable and compatible with other Sagrada expansions.

Name: To Arms!: Core Rules for Historical Battles
Description:
To Arms! is an easy and fast ruleset for historical games.

This core rulebook focus on the ancient part but the rules can be used for 3000BC~1865AD.

The book is written in simple English. 
It's very easy to read and understand.

Diagrams in each key step guide you how to play the game.

The featured Order of Activation makes the game feel like a RTS game. Not I-Go-U-Go, no PIPs. All the troops have chance to move in every turn.

The game length is about 1 Hour. You only need A Tape Measure and Some D6 Dice. Almost no counters or markers are needed. No chart looking, most of the combat is judged by Roll-Off. Figures are individually based and formed in ranks and files. If you want to play with DBx bases, that's also fine. You just need some markers to track the casualty.

Overall, it's a easy and fast ruleset. It's good for beginners. Experienced players can also have funs. To Arms! is not a highly realistic battle simulation but a game of leisure and fun.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kabammm!
Description:
Elevate your reflexes and visual perception to superhero level when playing Kabammm! Get rid of your cards quickly by matching icons and take advantage of powerful combo moves! The more you play Kabammm! the faster you will become.

Flip a card and quickly overlay your card by matching two icons.  Shout your superhero call and make combos by matching the right colors. First player with no cards left wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Lucy Hammett's Texas Bingo
Description:
Facts about the Lone Star State can be learned while playing Texas Bingo. A few characters are Alamo, Armadillo and Bluebonnet.

A creative spin on classic bingo featuring brilliant color photos and informative facts on the back of each calling card. Suggestions for different ways to “Bingo” are on the back of each game box to add interest to playing the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sei keine Pussy
Description:
Get to know your friends or strangers really well in this intimate question-anser-card game.

Pick a card with questions and pick a person you want to answer a question. He/she picks the number and the question is asked.
Now you both have 3 answer cards as options: Yes, No or I am a pussy (you don't want to answer or you play a meta game).
If the questioner is right about the answer of the questionee he gets the question card as a point. If he is not right the questionee gets the cards as a point.

Play this funny game as a party game with friends or soon to be friends. It's a quick party game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Depicted
Description:
Depicted is a conceptual, abstract boardgame where players match images with attributes to gain territory.

Matching justification can vary by age group and is designed to encourage dialogue and conceptual thinking.

Tiles are flipped to claim spaces by arrow direction.
Players score a point every time they control four contiguous spaces.

The board constantly changes as board spaces are reclaimed with new images, making for a very dynamic game. 
The first player to accumulate 20 points wins.

Themes:
 * Symbols - uses coloured shapes
 * Classic - use generic images
 * Nature - Mother Nature
 * Muskoka - Ontario Canada cottage country.

Game Components:

The 12x12 inch x 1/4 inch laser-cut wooden game board consists of:
 * room for 100 or 121 territorial tile spaces 
 * four built-in scoring tracks.

The game includes:
 * at least 100 two-sided image tiles (depending on theme)
 * 20-40+ attribute cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Big Job
Description:
I’ve got a new job for you and your crew. There’s this new bank called the Mega Bank. The bank itself consists of 4 giant vaults. There must be millions stored in each. Your job is to find those vaults, stuff as much money down your pockets, and get out before you get busted. The police are stationed all around the bank. So you have to be careful. For the entire year, we can make this bank our primary target. So what do you say, are you in?

Welcome to The Big Job. The card game that tests your luck and greed to become rich. Are you lucky enough to hit the jackpot and avoid detection? Drawing the million dollar card and leaving with what you've got sounds like a lucky way to get rich. Or do you hunger the greed and adrenaline rush of taking hostages and pulling off some big time cash while dodging the police? Clearing out all the vaults and ransoming up a hostage for millions of dollars sounds right up your alley. Just try not to get busted in the process. It's going to cost ya! Grab your crew and lets head out for the big job!

If you're looking for a snatch and grab game to play with family and friends that requires no strategy, just sheer luck and greed, The Big Job is the perfect game for you. The Big Job is very easy to learn and play with others. Setup 4 decks and then just take turns pulling cards. Sounds very simple right? If only pulling money from a deck of cards was real. While the chances of getting caught are slim your greed will be your demise.

As The Big Job may seem like a very simple game with no strategy what so ever, it will keep you immersed with greed and other players’ demises. Trust us the only player that can hurt you is you. So make sure you choose wisely, whether it’s to keep drawing money or to just call it quits.

—description from the publisher

Name: Republican Roman 208~105BC: A To Arms! Supplement
Description:
Republican Roman 208~105BC contains a 3 pages PDF of army list and an A4 size file of troop cards!

—description from the publisher

Name: Gallic Army 40~105BC: A To Arms! Supplement
Description:
Gallic Army 40~105BC contains a 2 pages PDF of army list and an A4 size file of troop cards!

—description from the publisher

Name: Gogo CHALLENGE: Round 02
Description:
This is the second instalment in the Gogo CHALLENGE series. It's a game in puzzle form in which the tiles must be used to assemble a square by laying out square tiles in a way that adjacent tile edges show the same symbol. The pieces are "reversible" and each figure is "coded" so that one knows what there is on the other side of the card without having to turn it. There are multiple solutions. There are two difficulty levels: the Simple Gogo and the Supreme Gogo (more difficult).

Gogo Challenge can be played alone or against opponents with a timer.

Name: Cold War Air Supremacy: A Fast Paced Game of Air-to-Air Combat Set in the Second Cold War
Description:
Inspired by the 1986 movie Top Gun and its companion FASA game, Top Gun: The Game of Modern Fighter Combat, Cold War Air Supremacy is set in the years 1980 to 1991 and geared primarily to the technology and equipment in use during the later years of the Cold War era, commonly referred to as the Second Cold War. Future expansions will add in older fighters and technology and also more current fighters and technology.

Key features:

     Three levels of play for beginner/fast casual (Lieutenant JG), advanced (Veteran) and expert (Blue Max)*.
     Blind movement using 50 different maneuver cards for added intrigue.
     Aircraft, maneuver and pilot cards can be printed on standard business card stock for easy separation.
     Campaigns and scenarios based on historical and hypothetical events. (Coming soon!)
     10 playable aircraft of the most common fighters/interceptors from this era.
     5 NATO aircraft:
         F-14 Tomcat
         F-15 Eagle
         F-18 Hornet
         F-16 Falcon
         F-4 Phantom
    
     5 Warsaw Pact aircraft:
         MiG-23 Flogger
         MiG-25 Foxbat
         MiG-29 Fulcrum
         Su-15 Flagon
         Su-27 Flanker
    
     Printable 3'-0" wide x 4'-6" Combat Map with 1 1/2" hexes. Includes option to print only the hexes if you need to conserve ink.


Bonus: Cold War Air Supremacy: Aircraft Hanger - MiG-28 and F-20 Tigershark

—description from the publisher

Name: Continent Race
Description:
Continent Race by Byron’s Games is a world geography board game that features the national flags of countries throughout the world. The game is for 2+ players, ages 7 and up. It’s a race, and the first player to collect the required number of country cards from each continent wins the game. Supporting materials include Maps, Mystery Continent cards, Antarctica wild cards with special privileges, and there is an option to do a one-on-one challenge between 2 players to enhance the learning. The game is color-coded for easier access for children and allows for younger players to take part too. Continent Race is a collaborative way to learn world geography and promotes problem solving skills, goal achievement, and focused play. Continent Race is the recipient of 4 game awards.

For the basic level of play, the game is complete once a player collects the necessary number of country cards for three continents. Two cards must be collected from Australia/Oceania and four cards each from Africa, Asia, the Americas, and Europe. For the advanced level of the game is complete once a player collects the required number of cards for five continents. At this level, Orange Mystery cards can be shuï¬„ed into the deck to increase the level of diï¬ƒculty. Players must first determine which continent a Mystery card belongs to (using maps and other players as resources), then use the card as you would any other country card to complete a continent group. Also at the advanced level, Challenge play is an option, where one player invites another player to face oï¬€ with cards that feature the Challenge symbol. Each challenger gets to review the Continent List or Map and then, from memory, each player must name as many countries as s/he can recall from that continent by taking turns saying the names of countries aloud, until one player gets stumped. The winner of the challenge gets to draw additional cards.

Gameplay starts with the dealer dealing 7 cards, face down, to each player. On each turn, a player draws one card and discards one card face up. Each time a player discards, s/he must announce the country name and continent of the discarded card. On each turn, a player selects one card from the draw pile and decides if they want to keep it or discard it. If a player picks a country card that matches one of his/her continents and the country card completes one of the continent groups, then the player has successfully completed a continent group and must place the continent group on the table, face up, and announce the names of the countries in the continent group. (You can review phonetic pronunciations on our site.) Next, the player must replace, from the draw pile, the number of cards s/he laid down in order to bring the player’s hand back to 7 cards. Then, it’s the next player’s turn.

The ï¬rst person to collect the required number of country cards for each continent group is mere steps from winning the game! To fully complete the game, the winner MUST call out and locate on the maps the countries they’ve drawn throughout the game. Others may continue playing for 2nd, 3rd, 4th place… for an enhanced learning experience.

Continent Race was created by young Byron, just 6 years old at the time, during a month-long stay at a children’s hospital. Not only was Byron receiving treatment for an unexpected illness, he was receiving something else entirely: The inspiration to help kids like him learn and have fun through their hospital stay and beyond. Byron’s dream came to life in December 2018—with the help of a Kickstarter campaign, we sent Continent Race to over 130 children’s hospitals nationwide. NBC covered the story on Byron and his game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Petrolissima
Description:
Petrolissima shows the path of oil in Switzerland. The players take on the role of entrepreneurs working in the oil industry. Each of them can determine for themselves which areas of business they want to enter. The oil production chain goes from exploration and production of crude oil to the transport from the oil fields to Europe, the raffination in Europe and Switzerland - the processing of crude oil into products such as petrol, diesel or heting oil - and the final distrubution to the end customers.

In the game, all entrepreneurs start with the same capital - a handful of Petros, so to speak. They invest their capital into various business areas and/or trade on the oil markets with the goal of becoming the richests entrepreneur.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Petrolissima zeigt den Weg des Öls in die Schweiz. Die Spielenden schlüpfen in die Rolle von Unternehmern, die in der Ölbranche tätig sind. Es ist jedem einzelnen selbst überlassen, in welche Geschäftsbereiche sie oder er einsteigen will. Die Wertschöpfungskette der Ölbranche reicht dabei von der Exploration und Förderung von Rohöl über den Transport aus den Herkunftsgebieten nach Europa, der Raffination in Europa und der Schweiz – also der Verarbeitung von Rohöl in Handels- bzw. Gebrauchsprodukte wie Benzin, Diesel oder Heizöl – und der abschliessenden Distribution an den Endkunden.

Im Spiel starten alle Unternehmer mit dem gleichen Startkapital – so zu sagen einer Handvoll Petros. Mit dem Ziel, der reichste Unternehmer zu werden, investieren sie ihr Kapital in verschiedene Geschäftsbereiche und/oder betreiben Handel auf den Ölmärkten.

—description from the publisher

Name: Big Monster: Promo tiles
Description:
6 Tiles given for the winners of tournaments:


     4 Ice monster tiles
     1 Grassland tile
     1 Rune tile

Name: KeyForge: Mass Mutation – Archon Deck
Description:
Change is coming to the Crucible with the Mass Mutation set for the world’s only Unique Deck Game, KeyForge. Over 200 brand-new cards now enter the cardpool in the game’s fourth set, and the mutative power of the dark æmber has changed many of them, creating strange and unknown versions of once-familiar creatures. As gigantic creatures stretching across two cards lumber their way into battle, and House Sanctum makes its triumphant return, there has never been a more impactful time to leap into the fast-paced duels of KeyForge.

Each Mass Mutation Archon Deck contains a single, ready-to-play 36-card deck, bringing together three of the diverse Houses of the Crucible into a single deck—featuring its own mix of cards and unique from every other Archon Deck in existence.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fast Play Naval Rules for the 17th Century Anglo-Dutch Wars
Description:
These rules are based on a version of Fast Play Napoleonic Naval Rules that appeared in the first printed edition of the 'Wargames Journal' magazine several years ago.

They have been adapted and amended since then to reflect new interpretations of combat in 'the Age of Sail' and to learn from other rule systems.

These rules do not claim to be an original piece of work but have been created to fine-tune an already workable and enjoyable set of rules to ensure better game flow and address some period-specifc issues not covered in the original set.

T his simple version was amended and developed for a re-creation of the Battle of Sole Bay (1672) using 1:2400 scale ships with each model ship representing 4 actual ships.

The original rules were authored by Neil Fox.

—description from the rules introduction

Name: Close Fire & European Order: XVII – The Field of Battle - 1600-1700
Description:
Close Fire & European Order are wargames rules originally designed to re-create battles of the early 18th C in Europe with miniature figures. 
Many of the rule mechanisms have been developed from Andy Callan’s American War of Independence rules- Loose Files and American Scramble, which were originally published in Wargames Illustrated no. 1.  
This version is an adaptation which takes the rules back in time to the era of ‘pike and shot.’ The main focus of the 17th Century adaptation is the time of the Thirty Years War and the English Civil Wars (1620-1660). It also covers the early wars of Louis XIV of France up to the end of the 1600s.

The historical period covered by Close Fire XVII is one of transition from medieval to early-modern warfare marked by the increasing ascendancy of infantry and the transition from pike to shot.

At the heart of the rule mechanisms is the concept of Disorder Points (DPs). These were invented by Andy Callan for his American War of Independence rules and have proven to be an enduring and elegant way of reflecting the variable state of morale and combat effectiveness. A unit will incur DPs for manoeuvre, receiving fire, close combat and morale, and they will loose them by halting to redress ranks or through the intervention of a leader. The system is easy to use, does not require any paper work and dispenses with the need for lots of morale checks.

—extracted description from the rules introduction

Name: Close Fire & European Order: 16th C
Description:
Close Fire & European Order are wargames rules originally designed to re-create battles of the early 18th C in Europe with miniature figures.

This version is an adaptation which takes the rules back in time to the XVI Century

Name: Malbrook s'en va-t-en Guerre: Wargaming Rules for Large Battles 1700-1715
Description:
Malbrook s'en va-t-en Guerre are wargames rules designed to re-fight big battles of the War of Spanish Succession with 15mm or smaller scale miniatures. They are derived from my original Close Fire & European Order rules which cover the same time period but were designed for smaller engagements with a larger ground scale.

This big-battle variant of Close Fire & European Order allows players to fight out a full scale battle of
the War of Spanish Succession with a realistic ground scale and without getting bogged down in the minutiae of small brigade actions.
As it is the case with Close Fire & European Order, many of the rule mechanisms have been developed from Andy Callan’s American War of Independence rules- Loose Files and American Scramble, which were originally published in Wargames Illustrated no. 1.

In Malbrook, the basic game unit represents a brigade of 3-12 battalions of foot or 6-36 squadrons of horse. These brigades will need to be deployed into commands of several lines, as they were historically, in order to give support if the first line gets into trouble. The simple yet subtle command and control rules encourage players to keep their brigades together in historically realistic formations.
Brigades in range of their leader will usually act as the player wishes, however, if a command becomes broken up then the player will loose control and brigades may start doing things other than what he might wish.
In this period, effective musketry took place at 50-100 yards, In order to re-fight big battles, this distance is reduced to 1-2 inches on the games table. Therefore, musketry is incorporated into close combat.
At the heart of the rule mechanisms is the concept of Disorder Points (DPs). These were invented by Andy Callan for his American War of Independence rules and have proven to be an enduring and elegant way of reflecting the variable state of morale and combat effectiveness. A brigade will incur DPs for manoeuvre, receiving artillery fire, close combat and morale, and they will lose them by halting to redress ranks or through the intervention of a leader. The system is easy to use, does not require any paper work and dispenses with the need for lots of morale checks.

Designed with 15mm in mind, rules can be adapted for other scales.

—description from the rules introduction
Families: History: War of the Spanish Succession

Name: DunFi Escape
Description:
Try to make your way through 59 dungeon areas and have legendary songs sung about your wits, bravery and cunning....  or will you die horribly? Yes, the answer is yes... you will die horribly. Good Luck!

A 9-card, dice rolling 'continuing dungeon' layout in which you are being constantly chase by an unknown 'creature'.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ambiguity: A Game of Decent Deductions
Description:
In Ambiguity, you try to be first to deduce the secret items (words) of your opponents. Each player secretly picks an item from over 400 items. Clues, in the form of attributes, are revealed and players use them, or lack thereof, to guess who has what item.

The box of lasercut components includes: 

     450 “items” on 45 cards
     105 attributes on 35 cards (describe items)
     60 indicator tokens in six colours
     3 special revelation cards 
     12 “Take a Guess” cards
     2 gameboards
     20 deduction forms (more on our website).


After a brief setup, the game play folllows:  

     A player pulls an Attribute card and places it into the Attributes grid in an unused slot – one without indicator tokens
     Each player whose mystery item matches one of the attributes on the card must place their coloured token on the card without revealing the actual attribute
     Players will record any deductions on their forms.


Players can make guesses of other players’ items at any time, although you shouldn’t do so until enough attributes have been exposed – no need to waste your limited “Take a Guess” cards.

Attributes describe item qualities and categories. All items will have at least three attributes. Some items will have ambiguous attributes out of context. For example, CHEDDAR is both a CHEESE and a CITY while MERCURY is a GOD, a LIQUID, a PLANET, ROUND, METALLIC, SILVER-coloured and in the SOLAR SYSTEM.

—description from the publisher

Name: 上海 (Billionaire)
Description:
Chinese language Monopoly clone that renames all the spaces and modifies some rules. For example, there are more limits on the number of houses.

Includes cartoon illustrations on the board and replaces the dice with a plastic spinner giving numbers 1-12, thus changing the landing probabilities.

Includes four large, clear plastic pawns, 27 clear plastic houses, 8 clear plastic hotels and two six-sided dice.

—user summary

Name: Mit Blut und Eisen: A Set of Wargaming Rules for Large Battles of the Mid 19th Century European and American Wars
Description:
Mit Blut und Eisen are rules for European style battles in the period 1840 - 1880. 
Battles in the rest of the world can also be fought a long as the forces are similar to those used in Europe at the time. For example the American Civil War.

The focus of the rules is on the Crimean War (1853-56), the Franco-Austrian War of 1859, the American Civil War (1861-1865), the War of 1866 and the Franco-Prussian War of 1870-1871. Details of other conflicts during the period will be available later.

The rules are for large battles of this period. 
The players will usually command a Corps or other large part of a full army, if not the whole army.

One base usually represents 600 infantry, 300 cavalry or 12 guns. 
A unit is usually 3 to 12 bases and represents a brigade.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dice Monster
Description:
Dice Monster - The darkness monster came to this world. Someone summoned them for their own sins, fulfil deeply cunning and ambitious.  Players will play as heroes who was students in this school or the adventurers with special abilities, ultimate skill and dice power.

Roll your dices! caught the darkness monster then fliped to backside, changed the darkness to be your good friends...the little monster. Depending on the players' decision, bet your luck and keep eyes on monsters until the boss will unlock and appear.

Semi-cooperation with your friends when the boss came out! , but the only one could win. The student who got the most points from their little monsters will win this game.

Do not forget to learn the characters base story for fun!

—description from the publisher

Name: Codenames: Blizzard Edition
Description: Codenames: Blizzard Edition is an officially licensed edition of Codenames, published by The Op Games for Blizzard Entertainment.  This edition was not a retail product, only being made available to Employees of Blizzard Entertainment as a company Holiday Gift in 2019.

Name: Wakfu TCG: Incarnam
Description:
First expansion of the Wakfu Trading card game.

This expansion contains 320 cards, including 16 of fixed rarity, 121 common, 121 uncommon, 59 rare and 3 draconic, distributed as following:

     12 Heroes
     4 Haven Bags
     125 Allies
     95 Actions
     14 Areas
     12 Rooms
     54 Items
     4 Dofus (including 3 draconic)


Each booster was containing 1 rare or draconic card, 4 uncommon, 9 common and one lottery card for Dofus (the video game).

—user summary

Première extension du TCG Wakfu.

Cette extension contient 320 cartes, dont 16 de rareté fixe, 121 communes, 121 non communes, 59 rares et 3 draconiques, réparties de la façon suivante:

     12 Héros
     4 Havre* sacs
     125 Alliés

—user summary (French)

Name: Wakfu TCG: Astrub, La Menace Roublarde
Description:
Second expansion of the Wakfu Trading card game.

This expansion contains 162 cards, including 60 common, 60 uncommon, 39 rare and 3 draconic, distributed as following:

     71 Allies
     50 Actions
     7 Areas

Third expansion of the Wakfu Trading card game.

Name: Wakfu TCG: Bonta & Brâkmar
Description:
Fourth expansion of the Wakfu Trading card game.

This expansion contains 320 cards, including 16 of fixed rarity, 121 common, 121 uncommon, 58 rare and 4 protectors, distributed as following:

     12 Heroes
     4 Haven Bags
     156 Allies
     71 Actions
     10 Areas
     7 Rooms
     56 Items
     4 Protectors


Each booster was containing 1 rare or protector card, 4 uncommon, 9 common and one lottery card for Dofus (the video game).

—user summary

Quatrième extension du TCG Wakfu.

Cette extension contient 320 cartes, dont 16 de rareté fixe, 121 communes, 121 non communes, 58 rares et 4 protecteurs, réparties de la façon suivante:

     12 Héros
     4 Havre* sacs
     156 Alliés
     71 Actions
     10 Zones
     7 Salles
     56 Equipements
     4 Protecteurs


Chaque booster contenait 1 carte rare ou protecteur, 4 cartes peu communes, 9 cartes communes et 1 carte de loterie DOFUS.

—user summary (French)

Name: Wakfu TCG: Pandala, La Dernière Rasade
Description:
Fifth expansion of the Wakfu Trading card game.

This expansion contains 162 cards, including 60 common, 60 uncommon, 38 rare and 4 protectors, distributed as following:

     1 Haven Bags
     88 Allies
     28 Actions
     9 Areas
     1 Rooms
     31 Items
     4 Protectors


Each booster was containing 1 rare or protector card, 4 uncommon, 9 common and one lottery card for Dofus (the video game).

—user summary

Cinquième extension du TCG Wakfu.

Cette extension contient 162 cartes, dont 60 communes, 60 non communes, 38 rares et 4 protecteurs, réparties de la façon suivante:

     88 Alliés
     28 Actions

Chaque booster contenait 1 carte rare ou protecteur, 4 cartes peu communes, 9 cartes communes et 1 carte de loterie DOFUS.

—user summary (French)

Name: Wakfu TCG: Otomaï, Poulpe Fiction
Description:
Sixth expansion of the Wakfu Trading card game.

This expansion contains 162 cards, including 60 common, 60 uncommon, 38 rare and 4 protectors, distributed as following:

     1 Hero
     89 Allies
     30 Actions
     8 Areas
     1 Rooms
     29 Items
     4 Protectors


Each booster was containing 1 rare or protector card, 4 uncommon, 9 common and one lottery card for Dofus (the video game).

—user summary

Sixième extension du TCG Wakfu.

Cette extension contient 162 cartes, dont 60 communes, 60 non communes, 38 rares et 4 protecteurs, réparties de la façon suivante:

     1 Héros
